Posts.Content: Thanks Chuck! Unfortunately I have yet to receive this information from the urologist but I understand it is in the mail and will pass it on when it arrives. Really appreciate your help.
Posts.Title: Prostrate Cancer

Posts.Content: I'm a 66 year old male who has recently been diagnosed with prostrate cancer. My urologist has informed me that one half of the prostrate is cancerous(PSA 18+) after a biopsy. He has subsequently booked me in for an MRI plus bone scan,but because I'm going through the public health system it looks like I will have to wait a minimum of six weeks, maybe longer. Naturally I'm worried at the delay despite the literature saying there is no need to panic as this type of cancer is slow growing. My point though is that if the cancer has spread beyond the prostrate then surely there is a need for urgency so that radiation treatment or surgery can commence at the earliest?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by VickieKay Sorry to hear of your situation. I too am new to prostate cancer. My Husband was diagnosed in November. I am very familiar with colorectal cancer although. When you say public health system, do you not have Medicare? I'm from down under -NZ- and don't have medical insurance.
